--- In junit@y..., Eric Heikkila <ericheikkila@y...> wrote:
> Regardless of whether it's built in or not, it's
> fairly easy to use JUnit.  Just import the files, set
> up the classpath, etc., and start writing tests.
> 
> If you need any specific help or examples, drop me an
> email at:
> 
> ericheikkila@y...
> 
> -Eric
> 
Thanks for the offer Eric. I am familiar with JUnit, but the criteria
here is not to overload this particular group of students too quickly.
I want to use the very simple BlueJ environment to nanny the students
( for a variety of reasons ) but also introduce unit testing very
quickly via TDD. It would be nicer if UT was relatively seamless at 
first. 
 
	David
